questions.question: In Unix, which command is used to find the differences between two files?
Which Unix command is used to sort lines of text files?
To search for a specific string in all files within a directory, which command should be used?
What does the fork() function do?
A CPU generates 64-bit addresses. If the page size is 8 KB, how many pages are in the virtual address space?
In Unix, what command is used to measure the time it takes to execute a command or script?
Which Unix command is used to display the contents of a text file?
A system has a cache hit rate of 95%, with a cache access time of 5 ns, and main memory access time of 50 ns. What is the effective access time?
In a 5-stage pipeline, the stages take 4 ns each. Due to branch misprediction, 10% of instructions are stalled for 2 cycles. What is the average instruction execution time for 1,000 instructions?
Which of the following is responsible for managing the flow of data between the CPU and peripheral devices, bypassing the CPU when needed?

What is the output of the following code snippet?


int main() {
    int i, j;
    int arr[5][5];
    
    for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
        for (j = 0; j < 5; j++) {
            arr[i][j] = i * j;
        }
    }
    
    printf("%d", arr[3][2]);
    
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?
#define MULTIPLY(a, b) a * b
int main() {
    printf("%d", MULTIPLY(2 + 3, 4 + 5));
}

What is the output of the following code snippet?
int main() {
    int a = 10, b = 5;
    printf("%d", a > b ? a - b : b - a);
}

What will be the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
    int x = 5, y = 10;
    printf("%d", ++x * y++);
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code snippet?


int main() {
    int a = 10, b = 5;
    int *p = &a, *q = &b;
    
    *p = *p + *q;
    *q = *p - *q;
    
    printf("%d, %d", a, b);
    
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
    int x = 5, y = 10;
    printf("%d", (x++) + (++y));
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
    int a = 5, b = 10, c = 15;
    printf("%d", (a > b) && (b > c));
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code snippet?

void func(int n) {
    if (n == 0)
        return;
    printf("%d ", n);
    func(n - 1);
    printf("%d ", n);
}
int main() {
    func(3);
    return 0;
}
What Unix command is used to create an empty file?

What is the output of the following code snippet?


int main() {
    char str[] = "C Programming";
    int len = sizeof(str) / sizeof(str[0]);
    
    printf("%d", len);
    
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

using namespace std;

class Base {
public:
    virtual void print() {
        cout << "Base ";
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    void print() override {
        cout << "Derived ";
    }
};

int main() {
    Base obj;
    Base* ptr = &obj;
    ptr->print();
    return 0;
}
Which of the following statements about virtual functions is incorrect?

options.a: They allow derived classes to override base class methods.
options.b: They must be declared in the base class.

questions.question:
What is the output of the following code?

using namespace std;

class Base {
public:
    Base() {
        cout << "Base ";
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    Derived() {
        cout << "Derived ";
    }
};

int main() {
    Derived d;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

using namespace std;

int main() {
    int x = 5;
    do {
        cout << x << " ";
    } while (--x);
    cout << x << " ";
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code snippet?

using namespace std;

class MyClass {
public:
    int num;
    MyClass() {
        num = 0;
    }
    MyClass(int x, int y = 0) {
        num = x + y;
    }
};

int main() {
    MyClass obj1;
    MyClass obj2(3);
    cout << obj1.num << " " << obj2.num;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

using namespace std;

class A {
public:
    virtual void display() {
        cout << "A";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void display() override {
        cout << "B";
    }
};

int main() {
    B b;
    A* aptr = &b;
    aptr->display();
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code snippet?

using namespace std;

class A {
public:
    virtual void display() {
        cout << "A" << endl;
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void display() override {
        cout << "B" << endl;
    }
};

int main() {
    B obj;
    A *ptr = &obj;
    ptr->display();
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code snippet?

using namespace std;

namespace outer {
    int x = 5;
    namespace inner {
        int x = 10;
    }
}

int main() {
    cout << outer::x << " " << outer::inner::x;
    return 0;
}
What command is used to display the current date and time in Unix?

What is the output of the following code?

using namespace std;

class A {
public:
    virtual void display() {
        cout << "A";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void display() override {
        cout << "B";
    }
};

int main() {
    B* bptr = new B;
    A* aptr = bptr;
    aptr->display();
    return 0;
}
In Unix, which command is used to list the contents of a directory?
Which normal form addresses the issue of transitive dependencies by allowing only a single candidate key in a relation?
Given the functional dependency set {A → B, B → C}, what is the transitive dependency in this case?
Which SQL command would you use to modify an existing record in a database?
Which SQL statement is used to remove a table's data without removing the table structure itself?
What does 'predicate pushdown' refer to in the context of query optimization?

options.a: Pushing filters as close to the data source as possible
options.b: Pushing filters to the application layer
options.d: Pushing aggregates to the SELECT clause

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a self-join in SQL?
What is the purpose of the SQL MERGE statement?

options.a: To insert new rows into a table
options.b: To update existing rows in a table
options.c: To delete rows from a table
options.d: To create a new table based on existing data

questions.question: In relational calculus, which type of calculus expresses a query using tuples to find the desired results?
Which metric measures the average time between two consecutive failures in a software system?
In a binary search tree (BST), what is the minimum number of children a node can have?
What is the space complexity of the Breadth-First Search algorithm in a graph?
What is the height of a tree with only one node?
In a binary tree, what is the maximum number of nodes at level L?
Which data structure can be used to implement Dijkstra's algorithm efficiently?
In a spiral order traversal of a matrix, what is the space complexity of the algorithm?
What is the time complexity of Breadth-First Search (BFS) on a graph with V vertices and E edges?
Which of the following is NOT a standard representation of graphs?
The term 'source control' is associated with:

options.b: Versioning and managing changes to code

questions.question: Which type of software testing focuses on finding defects by exploring the software's functionality without predefined test cases?
What does the term 'bias' refer to in machine learning?

options.a: The error due to overly simplistic assumptions in the learning algorithm
options.b: The error due to noise in the data
options.c: The difference between predicted and actual outcomes

questions.question: What is a common problem when using high-dimensional data?
In the context of software development, what does 'UAT' stand for?
Which technique is commonly used to handle missing data in a dataset by filling in missing values with the mean or median of the feature?
In which type of machine learning task does the model learn to map input data directly to a continuous output space?
What is the purpose of a software requirements document?

options.b: To specify how code should be written
options.c: To define what the software should do

questions.question: In hierarchical clustering, how are clusters merged together?

options.a: Based on the closest data points
options.c: Based on a pre-defined number of clusters
options.d: Based on the farthest data points

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using a decision tree for classification tasks?

options.a: It can model complex relationships between features.
options.c: It does not require feature selection.

questions.question: Which machine learning algorithm is used for finding associations and patterns in transactional data?
What is the primary purpose of the 'bagging' technique in ensemble learning?

options.a: Reducing overfitting by training multiple models on the same data
options.b: Combining the predictions of multiple models through voting

questions.question: What is the purpose of the DNS?

options.b: To translate domain names into IP addresses

questions.question: Which network topology connects devices in a linear fashion, with each device having exactly two neighbors?
Which OSI model layer is responsible for addressing and routing data packets at the network level?
Which of the following layers of the OSI model is responsible for establishing, managing, and terminating sessions?
In which type of attack does a hacker intercept and alter communication between two parties?
What is the default port number for HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol)?
Which IP address class is typically used for multicast addressing?
Which transport layer protocol provides connection-oriented, reliable data transmission?
Which software development model involves breaking a project into small, manageable parts called 'increments'?
Which protocol is commonly used for remotely accessing and managing network devices such as routers and switches?
In a system with 5 processes, if the average turnaround time is 20 ms, what is the total time taken for all processes?
What is the primary purpose of a process control block (PCB) in an operating system?

options.c: To store information about a running process

questions.question: In a disk scheduling algorithm, if the current head position is 50 and the request queue is [30, 20, 60, 10], what is the total seek time for the Shortest Seek Time First (SSTF) algorithm?
In the context of thread synchronization, what is a mutex used for?
In the Waterfall model, when is testing typically performed?
Which of the following is not a function of the memory manager in an operating system?
Which software development approach emphasizes adaptability and welcomes changing requirements even late in the development process?
Which scheduling algorithm selects the process with the highest priority for execution?
What is the primary purpose of a semaphore in process synchronization?

options.b: To protect critical sections of code

questions.question: What is the term for a situation where a process is waiting for a resource indefinitely and cannot proceed?
Which of the following are preprocessor directives in C?

options.A: #include
options.B: #define
options.C: #pragma

questions.question: Which of the following statements about functions in C are true?

options.A: Functions can return multiple values.
options.B: Functions can have variable number of arguments.
options.C: Functions can call themselves (recursion).

questions.question: Which of the following are true about C++ templates?

options.A: Templates allow writing generic classes and functions.
options.B: Templates can only be used with classes.
options.C: Templates are instantiated at compile time.
options.D: You can create function templates and class templates.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about destructors in C++ are true?

options.A: A destructor has the same name as the class but is preceded by a tilde (~).
options.B: A destructor can be overloaded.
options.C: A destructor is called automatically when an object goes out of scope.
options.D: A destructor must have a return type.

questions.question: Which of the following are applications of queues?

options.A: CPU Scheduling
options.B: Breadth-First Search (BFS)
options.C: Tree Traversal

questions.question: Which of the following algorithms are used for finding the shortest path in a graph?

options.A: Dijkstra's Algorithm
options.B: Bellman-Ford Algorithm
options.C: Floyd-Warshall Algorithm

questions.question: Which of the following are true about Unix environment variables?

options.A: They can be global or local.
options.B: They can be exported to child processes.
options.C: They can only store string values.

questions.question: Which of the following are true about the grep command in Unix?

options.A: It is used to search for patterns in files.
options.B: It supports regular expressions.
options.C: It can perform recursive searches.
options.D: It can count the number of matches.

questions.question: Which of the following are true about multiprocessor systems?

options.A: They have multiple CPUs that share the same memory.
options.B: They can improve performance through parallelism.
options.C: They are not suitable for real-time applications.
options.D: They can be either symmetric (SMP) or asymmetric (AMP).

questions.question: Which of the following are true about Direct Memory Access (DMA)?

options.A: It allows peripherals to directly access main memory.
options.B: It reduces CPU overhead for data transfer tasks.
options.C: It is used for high-speed data transfer.
options.D: It can only be used for input operations.

questions.question: Which of the following are true about file systems?

options.A: They manage the storage and retrieval of data.
options.B: They provide a logical structure for files.
options.C: They handle file permissions and access control.
options.D: They are not needed in networked environments.

questions.question: Which of the following are true about inter-process communication (IPC)?

options.A: It allows processes to communicate and synchronize their actions.
options.B: It can be achieved through shared memory and message passing.
options.C: It is only used in distributed systems.
options.D: It helps in achieving process concurrency.

questions.question: Which of the following are true about Ethernet?

options.A: It is a wired networking technology.
options.B: It uses the CSMA/CD access method.
options.C: It operates at the Data Link and Physical layers.

questions.question: Which of the following are true about Wi-Fi (Wireless Fidelity)?

options.A: It uses radio waves for communication.
options.B: It follows IEEE 802.11 standards.
options.C: It is used for wireless local area networking.

questions.question: Which of the following are examples of SQL aggregate functions?

options.A: SUM
options.B: COUNT
options.C: AVG

questions.question: Which of the following are types of database constraints?

options.A: NOT NULL
options.B: UNIQUE
options.C: FOREIGN KEY

questions.question: Which of the following are software development models?

options.A: Spiral model
options.B: Waterfall model
options.C: Iterative model

questions.question: Which of the following are true about version control systems?

options.A: They help manage changes to source code over time.
options.B: They allow multiple developers to work on the same codebase.
options.C: They provide a history of changes made to the code.
options.D: They are only used in open-source projects.

questions.question: Which of the following are true about reinforcement learning?

options.A: It involves an agent interacting with an environment.
options.B: It uses rewards and penalties to learn.
options.C: It is suitable for dynamic environments.

questions.question: Which of the following are true about neural networks?

options.A: They are inspired by the human brain.
options.B: They consist of layers of interconnected nodes.
options.C: They are only used for image recognition tasks.
options.D: They can be used for both classification and regression.
